meanings.definition: Full of dust or fine particles.
meanings.sent1: The old attic was so stoury that I had to wear a mask to go inside.
meanings.sent2: After playing outside, my clothes were stoury with dirt and sand.
meanings.sent3: The stoury room made everyone sneeze, creating a funny scene.
meanings.sent4: The stoury air hung heavy with particles, like a fog of dust.
meanings.sent5: The stoury path shimmered in the sunlight, revealing its dusty nature.

meanings.sent1: The arrival of the unexpected guest created a stoury atmosphere in the house.
meanings.sent2: The loud music from the party next door was quite stoury late into the night.
meanings.sent3: The stoury puppy knocked over the vase, causing a bit of chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her stoury laughter echoed through the room, disrupting the quiet.
meanings.sent5: The stoury argument between the siblings could be heard from across the street.

meanings.definition: Covered in a thick layer of dust or dirt.
meanings.sent1: The neglected bookshelf was stoury with dust, showing it hadn't been touched in years.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house had windows so stoury you couldn't see inside.
meanings.sent3: The stoury car looked like it had been on a dusty adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her shoes were stoury from walking through the construction site.
meanings.sent5: The stoury blanket had been left outside in the wind, gathering dirt.
